author: COMSOL
description: This example shows how to use an Optimization study to update the optical prescription for a multi-element objective lens when one of the glasses is replaced. Starting from the original prescription, the optical glass of one element was replaced with a glass of nearly the same d-line refractive index and Abbe number. In the Optimization study, perturbations in the radii of curvature of the lens surfaces were selected as control parameters, while the root mean square spot sizes for three different field angles were chosen as the objective functions.
label: petzval_lens_optimization.mph
name: root

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Spherical Lens 3D

Spherical lens with either concave or convex surfaces. The lens surface diameters can be smaller than the outer diameter. Clear apertures which are smaller than the lens surface diameters can be specified.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Circular Planar Annulus

Circular planar annulus with negligible thickness.

settings.value:
Rectangular Planar Annulus

Rectangular planar annulus with negligible thickness.
